Package io.github.ydlv.javadoc_gh_pages_example.math.linalg

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
io.github.ydlv.javadoc_gh_pages_example.math.linalg.Matrix
public class Matrix extends Object
Represents a matrix.

      Creates a new matrix with the specified data. The array will be deep-copied.
      Parameters:

    • identity

      public static Matrix identity(int size)
      Returns an identity matrix of the specified size. For a shorter alias, see eye(int)
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the matrix (amount of rows, which is also equal to the amount of columns)
      Returns:
      the identity matrix of that size

    • eye

      public static Matrix eye(int size)
      Returns an identity matrix of the specified size. This method is a shorter alias for identity(int)
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the matrix (amount of rows, which is also equal to the amount of columns)
      Returns:
      the identity matrix of that size

    • constant

      public static Matrix constant(int rowCount, int colCount, double value)
      Returns a constant matrix of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      rowCount - the amount of rows
      colCount - the amount of columns
      value - the value of all elements
      Returns:
      a matrix of size rowCount x colCount where all the elements are value

    • zeros

      public static Matrix zeros(int rowCount, int colCount)
      Returns a matrix filled with zeros of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      rowCount - the amount of rows in the matrix
      colCount - the amount of columns in the matrix
      Returns:
      a matrix of size rowCount x colCount where all the elements are 0

    • ones

      public static Matrix ones(int rowCount, int colCount)
      Returns a matrix filled with ones of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      rowCount - the amount of rows in the matrix
      colCount - the amount of columns in the matrix
      Returns:
      a matrix of size rowCount x colCount where all the elements are 1

    • multiply

      public Matrix multiply(Matrix other)
      Returns the product of this matrix with the other matrix. The other matrix must have the same amount of rows as this matrix has columns. The returned matrix will have same amount of rows as this matrix has rows and amount of columns as the other matrix has columns.
      Parameters:
      other - a matrix by which this matrix is multiplied.
      Returns:
      this x other

    • transpose

      public Matrix transpose()
      Returns a transposed copy of this matrix. A transposed copy has the same amount of rows as the amount of columns and the same amount of columns as the amount of rows. For the returned matrix, the (i, j)-th element is the (j, i)-th element of this matrix.
      Returns:
      a transposed copy of this matrix

    • add

      public Matrix add(Matrix other)
      Returns the sum of this matrix with the other matrix. The other matrix must have the same amount of rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      other - the other matrix
      Returns:
      this + other

    • minus

      public Matrix minus(Matrix other)
      Returns the difference of this matrix with the other matrix. The other matrix must have the same amount of rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      other - the other matrix
      Returns:
      this - other

    • multiply

      public Matrix multiply(double scalar)
      Returns the product of this matrix with the scalar
      Parameters:
      scalar - the scalar by which this matrix is multiplied
      Returns:
      this * scalar

    • minor

      public Matrix minor(int i, int j)
      Calculates the minor of this matrix. The minor of a matrix A of size m x n is a matrix M of size m-1 x n-1, that is identical to A except that the i-th row and the j-th column are removed.
      Parameters:
      i - the row index of the minor
      j - column index of the minor
      Returns:
      the minor matrix

    • determinant

      public double determinant()
      Calculates the determinant of this matrix. The determinant of a matrix A of size m x n is the product of the numbers on the main diagonal of A.
      Returns:
      The determinant of this matrix Note: The implementation is using a recursive formula based on the minor(int, int) method. This has O(n!) time complexity and thus is not recommended for large matrices. There exist polynomial time algorithms that can be used instead, but this one is used here for simplicity of implementation, as this module is not meant for any real-world application, and is only meant to demonstrate Javadoc.
